title: Score Amnesty Experiment
outcome: Oksana Lintz and Lenart Kova announce a citywide 'score amnesty,' temporarily resetting all BCI profiles to neutral while the system is reevaluated. Community meetings spring up as residents begin discussing reform openly. Harmonists hesitate, Directorate resists, but early amnesty successes win tentative public goodwill. Underlying tensions surface as ghosts share more details, and Council debates future governance.

events.description: Oksana Lintz and Lenart Kova announce a two-week score amnesty, resetting all residents’ BCI profiles to neutral status. Protests pause as citizens consider the implications.
Neighborhood community forums begin discussing citizen-driven reforms and recounting experiences with BCI abuses during the amnesty window.
Ghosts host a public assembly, sharing hidden details about erasures and rallying support for lasting change in the BCI system.
Council debates fractious future directions: permanent amnesty, a reformed BCI, or reinstating the original system. Directorate threatens to withdraw support if amnesty continues.
With amnesty ending, demand surges for more transparency and a permanent system overhaul as citizens resist return to compliance scoring.
